summary: This is a letter from the law firm Smith Viltozor LLP to Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding the United States v. Maxwell case. It informs the court of a third production of documents responsive to Ghislaine Maxwell's subpoena, specifically claim packets and email communications with attorneys for four individuals identified in the subpoena, which have been posted to a secure FTP site.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The presiding judge in the Southern District of New York to whom the letter is addressed regarding the document production in the United States v. Maxwell case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (United States v. Maxwell, No. 20 Cr. 330) for whom the subpoena was issued, leading to the document production described.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against Maxwell, as indicated by the case caption 'United States v. Maxwell' and the letter being addressed to her.

events.title: Court's memo-endorsement of letter
events.description: The Court issued a memo-endorsement regarding a November 23, 2021 letter from the law firm, authorizing or acknowledging the document production process.

events.title: Court order on FTP site
events.description: The Court issued an order indicating that posting documents to a secure FTP site was a sufficient means of providing them.

events.title: Third document production to court
events.description: Smith Viltozor LLP, on behalf of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program administrator, makes a third production of documents (claim packets and attorney emails) responsive to Maxwell's subpoena to the court.

locations: 40 Foley Square, New York, New York 10007
250 West 55th Street, 30th Floor, New York, NY 10019
keyFacts: This document is part of the discovery process in United States v. Maxwell, where the defendant issued a subpoena for documents.
The independent administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program is producing documents in response to Maxwell's subpoena.
The production includes claim packets and email communications with attorneys for four specific individuals identified in the subpoena.
Documents have been redacted to protect other claimants and in accordance with Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 49.1(a).
The documents were delivered via a secure FTP site, as authorized by a prior court order.
